java.lang.Object
de.gmxhome.conrad.jpos.jpos_base.JposBase
de.gmxhome.conrad.jpos.jpos_base.linedisplay.LineDisplayService
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class LineDisplayService extends JposBase implements jpos.services.LineDisplayService115
LineDisplay service implementation. For more details about getter, setter and method implementations, see JposBase.

  • Field Details

    • LineDisplayInterface

      public LineDisplayInterface LineDisplayInterface
      Instance of a class implementing the LineDisplayInterface for line display specific setter and method calls bound to the property set. Almost always the same object as Data.

    • outputDataParts

      LineDisplayService.DisplayDataPart[] outputDataParts(String data, int attribute)
      Parses output data for escape sequences and valid control characters CR and LF. See UPOS specification for DisplayText, chapter Data Characters and Escape Sequences. Returns list of objects that describe all parts of the output string. These objects can be used by display functions to check display data and to generate generic output data. Possible objects in list have one of the following types:
      • DisplayData - Class containing character strings with printable characters only. See PrintData for details.
      • ControlChar - Control character object containing CR or LF.
      • EscNormalize - Class containing information about details of a normalize command. See EscNormalize for details.
      • EscBitmap - Class containing information about details of a bitmap command. See EscBitmap for details.
      • EscSimple - Class containing information about details of a simple attribute command. See EscSimple for details.
      • EscUnknown - Class containing information about details of an unknown escape sequence.
      Parameters:
      data - Character string to be displayed. May contain CR, LF and ESC sequences as described in the UPOS specification.
      attribute - Text attribute to be used. See UPOS description.
      Returns:
      array of objects that describe all parts of data.
